intro: Chlorophytum gallabatense var. floribundum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of vibrant, showy flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Its ability to produce multiple flower spikes makes it a favored choice for indoor gardening.
